intro: Uncinia phleoides var. nux-nigra, commonly known as the black walnut variant, is a variant of the genus Uncinia, which belongs to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its dark, ridged fruiting bodies that resemble small, elongated nuts. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a distinctive, slightly serrated margin. This variant is notable for its potential use in traditional medicine and its role in local ecosystems.
